name: ryegrass
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a kind of grass that is used to feed animals and for lawns (= areas of grass, especially near a house, that are cut regularly to keep them short): The golf course comprises 97% ryegrass with a small percentage of other grasses. Most grassland is ploughed up every few years and reseeded with a mix of rye grass and clover.
More examplesFewer examplesThe silage fields that you find everywhere nowadays are little more than monocultures of perennial ryegrass.Durability is the chief virtue of rye grass, which is why we chose it. A mixture of perennial ryegrasses offers outstanding performance.
